record.id: field.name="reset" and file.name="formatctrl" and term=NULL and format.name=NULL and syslanguage="en"
record.field.name: reset
record.file.name: formatctrl

brief.brief: Indicates whether, if the $file variable is modified in the called application, to keep the changes or reset the variable back to its original state before calling the other application.
Since the passed variables are on the parameter panels (and thus are local variables), the variable contains the value it had in the called application if this function is true.

detail.detail: For example, if the value of a field in $file (the current record) was true before being passed to the application, and upon return to the Format Control record it has a value of false, the field retains the value of false if the reset on return function were set to false.
Options set to true will exit to the Home menu rather than returning the operator to the form specified in the Format to Display field.
